stem: Compression of the ulnar nerve in Guyon’s canal most commonly produces which pattern?

choices.A: Sensory loss digits 4–5 with thenar weakness
choices.B: Sensory loss digits 4–5 with weakness of interossei
choices.C: Radial deviation with wrist flexion but intact sensation

rationale_correct: Ulnar canal lesions can affect sensation to digits 4–5 and the deep motor branch to interossei/hypothenar muscles.

rationale_distractors.C: Radial deviation with flexion suggests ulnar lesion at elbow (FCU).
rationale_distractors.D: Wrist drop is a radial neuropathy.
rationale_distractors.E: Dorsal radial hand sensation is radial nerve territory.

evidence.citation: Selski D. Nerve Injuries of the Upper Limb (Slides). 2022.
